short_text: The Surah takes its name from its first word al-qari'ah. This is not only a name but also the title of its subject matter, for the Surah is devoted to the subject of the Resurrection.
text: The Surah takes its name from its first word al-qari'ah. This is not only a name but also the title of its subject matter, for the Surah is devoted to the subject of the Resurrection.
There is no dispute about this surah being a Makki Surah. Its contents show that this too is one of the earliest Surahs to be revealed at Makkah.

Its theme is Resurrection and the Hereafter. At the outset, the people have been alerted and alarmed with: "The Great Disaster! What is the Great Disaster? And what do you know what the Great Disaster is?" After preparing the listeners for the news of the dreadful calamity, the Resurrection has been depicted before them in two sentences, saying that on that Day people will be running about in confusion and bewilderment like many scattered moths around a light, and the mountains uprooted, will fly about like carded wool. Then it has been said that when Allah's Court is established in the Hereafter and the people are called upon to account for their deeds, the people whose good deeds are found to be heavier than their evil deeds, will be blessed with bliss and happiness, and the people whose good deeds are found to be lighter than their evil deeds, will be cast into the deep pit full of burning fire.
description: The surah that opens with this single world, al-Qāriʿah, meaning The Catastrophe, for that is the repeated sound that shall resound through all the earth as it is being pulverized in the cataclysm at the end of time, levelled utterly for the Resurrection Day and the ultimate Judgment of every human soul. It takes its name from “the catastrophe” (al-qāriʿah) mentioned in verse 1 . The surah gives some scenes from the Resurrection and Judgement.The surah is also known as: The Calamity, The Clatterer, The Crashing Blow, The Day of Noise and Clamour, The Disaster, The Great Calamity, The Great Pounding, The Smiter, The Stunning (Blow).

Efendi Nahi.verse 101:3: Kush të tregon ty për Goditjen e tmerrshme?
Efendi Nahi.verse 101:4: Njerëzit, atë Ditë do të jenë të shpërndarë si fluturat,
Efendi Nahi.verse 101:5: kurse malet – si leshi i shprishur.
Efendi Nahi.verse 101:6: Atij (njeriut), veprat e mira të të cilit rëndojnë në peshojë
Efendi Nahi.verse 101:7: ai do të jetë në jetën e kënaqur (në jetën e përhershme),
Efendi Nahi.verse 101:8: e atij (njeriu), veprat e mira të të cilit nuk rëndojnë në peshojë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 101:9: strehimi i tij do të jetë gremina e Skëterrës.
Efendi Nahi.verse 101:10: E, kush të tregon ty se ç’është gremina e Skëterrës?

null.verse 101:3: Sən nə bilirsən (haradan bilirsən) ki, nədir qiyamət?!
null.verse 101:4: O gün insanlar kəpənək kimi ətrafa səpələnəcək (çəyirtkə kimi bir-birinə qatışacaq);
null.verse 101:5: Dağlar isə didilmiş yun kimi olacaqdır!
null.verse 101:6: (O gün) tərəzisi ağır gələn (yaxşı əmələri pis əməllərdən çox olan) kimsə,
null.verse 101:8: Tərəzisi yüngül gələn (yaxşı əməlləri pis əməllərdən az olan) kimsənin isə,
null.verse 101:10: Sən nə bilirsən ki, o (Haviyə) nədir?!

null.verse 101:3: i šta ti znaš o Smaku svijeta?
null.verse 101:4: Toga dana će ljudi biti kao leptiri raštrkani,
null.verse 101:5: a planine kao šarena vuna iščupana.
null.verse 101:6: Onaj u koga njegova djela budu teška -
null.verse 101:8: a onaj u koga njegova djela budu lahka -
null.verse 101:10: A znaš li ti šta će to biti? -

null.verse 101:3: করাঘাতকারী সম্পর্কে আপনি কি জানেন ?
null.verse 101:4: যেদিন মানুষ হবে বিক্ষিপ্ত পতংগের মত
null.verse 101:5: এবং পর্বতমালা হবে ধুনিত রঙ্গীন পশমের মত।
null.verse 101:6: অতএব যার পাল্লা ভারী হবে,
null.verse 101:8: আর যার পাল্লা হালকা হবে,
null.verse 101:10: আপনি জানেন তা কি?

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 101:3: И откъде да знаеш ти какво е Бедствието?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 101:4: Деня, в който хората ще бъдат като пръснати пеперуди
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 101:5: и планините ще бъдат като разпокъсана вълна...
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 101:10: А откъде да знаеш ти какво е тя?

null.verse 101:3: 你怎能知道大難是什麼？
null.verse 101:4: 在那日 ,眾人將似分散的飛蛾 ,
null.verse 101:5: 山岳將似疏松的釆絨。
null.verse 101:6: 至於善功的份量較重者 ,
null.verse 101:8: 至於善功的份量較輕者 ,
null.verse 101:10: 你怎能知道深坑裏有什麼？

null.verse 101:3: Víš ty vůbec, co je to roztříštěni?
null.verse 101:4: V ten den budou lidé jak můry rozptýlené
null.verse 101:5: a hory podobat se budou rozcupované vlně.
null.verse 101:6: Tehdy ten, jehož skutků váha bude těžká,
null.verse 101:8: zatímco ten, jehož skutků váha bude lehká -
null.verse 101:10: Víš ty vůbec, co je to Propast?

null.verse 101:3: En wat weet gij (er van) wat de ramp is?
null.verse 101:4: Een Dag waarop de mensen als motten verstrooid zullen zijn.
null.verse 101:5: En de bergen als gekaarde wol
null.verse 101:6: Dan zal hij, wiens schalen zwaar zijn,
null.verse 101:8: Doch hij, wiens schalen licht zijn,
null.verse 101:10: En gij weet niet, wat dit is.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 101:3: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Calamity is!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 101:4: A day wherein mankind will be as thickly-scattered moths
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 101:5: And the mountains will become as carded wool.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 101:6: Then, as for him whose scales are heavy (with good works),
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 101:7: He will live a pleasant life.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 101:8: But as for him whose scales are light,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 101:9: A bereft and Hungry One will be his mother,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 101:10: Ah, what will convey unto thee what she is! -

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:2: What is the (Day) of Noise and Clamour?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:3: And what will explain to thee what the (Day) of Noise and Clamour is?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:4: (It is) a Day whereon men will be like moths scattered about,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:5: And the mountains will be like carded wool.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:6: Then, he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) heavy,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:7: Will be in a life of good pleasure and satisfaction.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:8: But he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) light,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:9: Will have his home in a (bottomless) Pit.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 101:10: And what will explain to thee what this is?

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 101:3: And what shall teach thee what is the Clatterer?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 101:4: The day that men shall be like scattered moths,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 101:5: and the mountains shall be like plucked wool-tufts.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 101:6: Then he whose deeds weigh heavy in the Balance
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 101:8: but he whose deeds weigh light in the Balance
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 101:9: shall plunge in the womb of the Pit.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 101:10: And what shall teach thee what is the Pit?

Muhammad Asad.verse 101:3: And what could make thee conceive what that sudden calamity will be?
Muhammad Asad.verse 101:4: [It will occur] on the Day when men will be like moths swarming in confusion,
Muhammad Asad.verse 101:5: and the mountains will be like fluffy tufts of wool....
Muhammad Asad.verse 101:6: And then, he whose weight [of good deeds] is heavy in the balance
Muhammad Asad.verse 101:7: shall find himself in a happy state of life;
Muhammad Asad.verse 101:8: whereas he whose weight is light in the balance
Muhammad Asad.verse 101:9: shall be engulfed by an abyss.
Muhammad Asad.verse 101:10: And what could make thee conceive what that [abyss] will be?

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 101:3: And what may let you know what the Striking Event is?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 101:4: (It will happen) on a day when people will be like scattered moths,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 101:5: and the mountains will be like carded wool.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 101:6: Then, as for him whose scales (of good deeds) are heavy,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 101:7: he will be in a happy life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 101:8: But he whose scales are light,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 101:10: And what may let you know what that (Abyss) is?

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 101:3: And what will show you what the Clattering Blow is?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 101:4: The day mankind will be like scattered moths
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 101:5: and the mountains will be like tufts of wool.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 101:6: Then as for him whose scales weigh heavy,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 101:7: he will enjoy a pleasant life,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 101:8: but as for him whose scales weigh light,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 101:9: his home will be the Abyss.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 101:10: And what will show you what it is?

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:1: The high-scale jolt rocking (the whole universe of the heavens and the earth) and thunder!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:2: And what is that high-scale jolt rocking (everything) and that thunder?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:3: And what have you made out what the high-scale jolt and thunder implies?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:4: (It implies) the Day of Resurrection when (the whole of) mankind will become like scattered moths,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:5: And the mountains will be like multicoloured carded wool.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:6: So he whose scales of deeds in the balance will be heavy,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:7: He will be in luxury and delight.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:8: But as for him whose scales of deeds in the balance will be light,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:9: His abode will be Hawiya (a pit in Hell)!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:10: And what have you made out what that (Hawiya) is?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 101:11: It is (an extremely deep pit of) the fiercely Blazing Fire (of Hell).

null.verse 101:3: Ymmärrätkö, kuinka kauhea on vyöryvä tuho?
null.verse 101:4: Päivä, jolloin ihmiset ovat kuin hajoitettu sääksien parvi,
null.verse 101:5: ja vuoret kuin keritty villa.
null.verse 101:6: Sen osana, jonka hyvien tekojen mitta on suuri,
null.verse 101:8: mutta toisin käy sen, jonka hyvät teot vaa'assa keveiksi havaitaan,
null.verse 101:10: Tiedätkö, mikä horna on?

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 101:2: Qu'est-ce donc que le grand Coup ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 101:3: Qu'est-ce qui te fera savoir ce qu'est le grand Coup ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 101:4: C'est le Jour où les hommes seront comme des papillons éparpillés,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 101:5: et les montagnes semblables à de la laine cardée.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 101:6: Celui dont les œuvres pèseront lourd
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 101:8: mais celui dont la balance sera légère
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 101:10: Et qu'est-ce qui te fera savoir ce qu'est cet abîme ?

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 101:3: Et qui te dira ce qu’est le fracas ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 101:4: C’est le jour où les gens seront comme des papillons éparpillés,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 101:5: et les montagnes comme de la laine cardée;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 101:6: quant à celui dont la balance sera lourde
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 101:7: il sera dans une vie agréable;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 101:8: et quant à celui dont la balance sera légère,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 101:9: sa mère [destination] est un abîme très profond.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 101:10: Et qui te dira ce que c’est ?

null.verse 101:4: An einem Tage, da die Menschen gleich verstreuten Motten sein werden,
null.verse 101:5: Und die Berge wie Streichwolle werden.
null.verse 101:6: Dann wird der, dessen Waage schwer ist,
null.verse 101:8: Der aber, dessen Waage leicht ist,
null.verse 101:9: Die Hölle wird seine Mutter sein.
null.verse 101:10: Und was lehrt dich wissen, was das ist? -

null.verse 101:3: Tahukah kamu apakah hari Kiamat itu?
null.verse 101:4: Pada hari itu manusia seperti kupu-kupu yang bertebaran,
null.verse 101:5: dan gunung-gunung seperti bulu yang dihambur-hamburkan.
null.verse 101:6: Dan adapun orang-orang yang berat timbangan (kebaikan) nya,
null.verse 101:7: maka dia berada dalam kehidupan yang memuaskan.
null.verse 101:8: Dan adapun orang-orang yang ringan timbangan (kebaikan) nya,
null.verse 101:9: maka tempat kembalinya adalah neraka Hawiyah.
null.verse 101:10: Dan tahukah kamu apakah neraka Hawiyah itu?

null.verse 101:3: E chi potrà farti comprendere cos'è la Percotente?
null.verse 101:4: Il Giorno in cui gli uomini saranno come falene disperse,
null.verse 101:5: e le montagne come fiocchi di lana cardata,
null.verse 101:6: colui le cui bilance saranno pesanti
null.verse 101:8: colui che invece avrà bilance leggere,
null.verse 101:10: E chi potrà farti comprendere cos'è?

null.verse 101:1: 恐れ戦く日（最後の審判）
null.verse 101:3: 恐れ戦く日が，何であるかをあなたに理解させるものは何か。
null.verse 101:4: （それは）人間が飛散する蛾のようになる日。
null.verse 101:5: また山々が，梳かれた羊毛のようになる（日である）。
null.verse 101:6: それで，かれの秤が（善行で）重い者は，
null.verse 101:7: 幸福で満ち足りて暮らすであろう。
null.verse 101:8: だが秤の軽い者は，
null.verse 101:9: 奈落が，かれの里であろう。
null.verse 101:10: それが何であるかを，あなたに理解させるものは何か。

null.verse 101:3: 부활의 날이 무엇인지 무엇이그대에게 설명하리요
null.verse 101:4: 그날은 인간이 나방처럼 흩어지는 날이며
null.verse 101:5: 산들은 가지런한 양털처럼 되는 날로
null.verse 101:6: 그날 그의 선행이 무거운 자 는
null.verse 101:8: 그의 선행이 가벼운 자는
null.verse 101:10: 불지옥의 함정이 무엇인지 무엇이 그대에게 설명하려 주리요

null.verse 101:1: (یه‌کێکه له ناوه‌کانی ڕۆژی قیامه‌ت) واته‌: ئه‌و گرمه‌یه‌یی دڵان ده‌له‌رزێنێت.
null.verse 101:3: (تۆ ئه‌ی ئینسان) چی فێری کردویت که‌_القارعه‌_چی یه‌!!
null.verse 101:4: ئه‌و ڕۆژه خه‌ڵکی وه‌کو په‌پووله‌ی سه‌رگه‌ردان په‌رش و بڵاو ده‌بنه‌وه‌.
null.verse 101:5: کێوه‌کانیش وه‌کو خوری شیکراوه‌یان لێ دێت (سووك ده‌بن و چاڵ و چۆڵیان پێ پڕ ده‌کرێته‌وه‌).
null.verse 101:6: جا ئه‌وه‌ی ته‌رازووی خێری سه‌نگین بێت.
null.verse 101:7: ئه‌وه له بارودۆخێکی خۆش و ئاسووده‌دا ژیان ده‌باته سه‌رو زۆر پێی ڕازیه‌.
null.verse 101:8: ئه‌وه‌ش ته‌رازووی (خێرو چاکه‌ی) سووك بێت (گوناهی زۆر بێت).
null.verse 101:9: ئه‌وه دایکی ئه‌و دۆزه‌خه (باوه‌شی بۆ کردۆته‌وه‌)
null.verse 101:10: جا تۆ چووزانی (هاویه‌) چیه‌؟!
null.verse 101:11: ئاگرێکی زۆر سوتێنه‌رو بڵێسه‌داره (هه‌رگیز خامۆش نابێت و تینی که‌م ناکات و له کۆڵی نابێته‌وه‌).

null.verse 101:2: Apa dia hari yang menggemparkan itu?
null.verse 101:3: Dan apa jalannya engkau dapat mengetahui kedahsyatan hari yang menggemparkan itu?
null.verse 101:4: (Hari itu ialah: Hari kiamat), hari manusia menjadi seperti kelkatu yang terbang berkeliaran,
null.verse 101:5: Dan gunung-ganang menjadi seperti bulu yang dibusar berterbangan.
null.verse 101:6: Setelah berlaku demikian, maka (manusia akan diberikan tempatnya menurut amal masing-masing); adapun orang yang berat timbangan amal baiknya;
null.verse 101:7: Maka dia berada dalam kehidupan yang senang lenang.
null.verse 101:8: Sebaliknya orang yang ringan timbangan amal baiknya;
null.verse 101:10: Dan apa jalannya engkau dapat mengetahui, apa dia "Haawiyah" itu?
null.verse 101:11: (Haawiyah itu ialah): Api yang panas membakar.

null.verse 101:3: و تو چه مى‏دانى كه حادثه كوبنده چيست؟! (آن حادثه همان روز قيامت است!)
null.verse 101:4: روزى كه مردم مانند پروانه‏هاى پراكنده خواهند بود،
null.verse 101:5: و كوه‏ها مانند پشم رنگين حلاجى‏شده مى‏گردد!
null.verse 101:6: اما كسى كه (در آن روز) ترازوهاى اعمالش سنگين است،
null.verse 101:7: در يك زندگى خشنودكننده خواهد بود!
null.verse 101:8: و اما كسى كه ترازوهايش سبك است،
null.verse 101:10: و تو چه مى‏دانى «هاويه‏» چيست؟!

null.verse 101:3: E o que te fará entender o que é a calamidade?
null.verse 101:4: (Acontecerá) no dia em que os homens estiverem como mariposas dispersas,
null.verse 101:5: E as montanhas como lã cardada!
null.verse 101:6: Porém, quanto àqueles cujas ações pesarem na balança,
null.verse 101:8: Em troca, aquele cujas ações forem leves na balança,
null.verse 101:10: E o que é que te fará entender isso?

Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 101:3: Și de unde sã știi tu ce este “Ziua aceea care lovește”?
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 101:4: În Ziua aceea, oamenii vor fi ca fluturii risipiți ,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 101:5: Iar munții vor fi ca lâna scãrmãnatã!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 101:6: Cât despre cel ale cãrui balanțe vor fi grele,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 101:7: El va avea parte de o viațã plãcutã ,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 101:8: Iar cât despre cel ale cãrui balanțe vor fi ușoare,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 101:9: Locul lui de veci va fi un abis.
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 101:10: Și de unde sã știi tu ce este el?

George Grigore, Coranul.verse 101:2: Ce este oare cea care bate!
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 101:3: Cum vei şti tu oare ce este cea care bate?
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 101:4: Ea va fi Ziua când oamenii vor fi ca fluturii împrăştiaţi,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 101:6: Când cele-i cântărite greu vor atârna,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 101:7: un trai de mulţumire va afla.
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 101:8: Când cele-i cântărite uşor vor atârna,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 101:9: genunea este maica ce îşi va afla.
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 101:10: Şi cum o vei cunoaşte, oare?

null.verse 101:3: Что объяснит тебе,Каков он — День Бича?
null.verse 101:4: В тот ДеньРассеются, подобно мотылькам, вселюди,
null.verse 101:5: Подобно паутинкам легкой шерсти,Повиснут горы.
null.verse 101:6: И для того, чьи добрые деяньяперевесят,
null.verse 101:7: Жизнь уготована в прекрасном Рае,Где он найдет блаженство и покой.
null.verse 101:8: Но тот, кто легковесен был в земныхдеяньях,
null.verse 101:9: Найдет убежище себе во Рву бездонном.
null.verse 101:10: Как объяснить тебе, каков он, этот Ров?

null.verse 101:3: Y ¿cómo sabrás qué es la calamidad?
null.verse 101:4: El día que los hombres parezcan mariposas dispersas
null.verse 101:5: y las montañas copos de lana cardada,
null.verse 101:6: entonces, el autor de obras de peso
null.verse 101:8: miemtras que el autor de obras ligeras
null.verse 101:10: Y ¿cómo sabrás qué es?

null.verse 101:3: திடுக்கிடச் செய்யும் (நிகழ்ச்சி) என்ன வென்று உமக்கு எது அறிவித்தது?
null.verse 101:4: அந்நாளில் சிதறடிக்கப்பட்ட ஈசல்களைப் போன்று மனிதர்கள் ஆகிவிடுவார்கள்.
null.verse 101:5: மேலும், மலைகள் கொட்டப்பட்ட பஞ்சைப் போன்று ஆகிவிடும்.
null.verse 101:6: எனவே, (அந்நாளில்) எவருடைய (நன்மையின்) நிறை கனத்ததோ-
null.verse 101:8: ஆனால் எவனுடைய (நன்மையின்) நிறை இலேசாக இருக்கிறதோ-
null.verse 101:10: இன்னும் ('ஹாவியா') என்ன என்று உமக்கு அறிவித்தது எது?

null.verse 101:1: อัลกอริอะฮ์
null.verse 101:2: อัลกอริอะฮ์นั้นคืออะไร?
null.verse 101:3: และอะไรที่ทำให้เจ้าได้รู้ว่าอัลกอริอะฮ์ นั้นคืออะไร?
null.verse 101:4: วันที่มนุษย์จะเป็นเช่นแมลงเม่าที่กระจายว่อน
null.verse 101:5: และบรรดาภูเขาจะเป็นเช่นขนสัตว์ที่ปลิวว่อน
null.verse 101:6: ส่วนผู้ที่ตราชูของเขาหนัก
null.verse 101:7: เขาก็จะอยู่ในการมีชีวิตที่ผาสุก
null.verse 101:8: และส่วนผู้ที่ตราชูของเขาเบา
null.verse 101:9: ที่พำนักของเขาก็คือเหวลึก (ฮาวิยะฮ์)
null.verse 101:10: และอะไรเล่าที่ทำให้เจ้ารู้ได้ว่าเหวลึกคืออะไร?
null.verse 101:11: คือไฟอันร้อนแรง

null.verse 101:3: O Kârianın ne olduğunu bilir misin?
null.verse 101:4: İnsanların, ateşin etrafını sarmış pervaneler gibi olur,
null.verse 101:5: Dağların da atılmış renkli yüne dönüştüğü gündür (o Kâria!)
null.verse 101:6: O gün kimin tartılan ameli ağır gelirse.
null.verse 101:7: İşte o, hoşnut edici bir yaşayış içinde olur.
null.verse 101:8: Ameli yeğni olana gelince.
null.verse 101:10: Nedir o (Hâviye) bilir misin?

null.verse 101:3: Қориъат қандоқ нарса эканлигини сенга нима билдирди?
null.verse 101:4: У кунда одамлар тўзиб кетган капалакка ўхшаб қоларлар.
null.verse 101:5: Ва тоғлар титилган жунга ўхшаб қолар.
null.verse 101:6: Кимнинг торозуси оғир келса...
null.verse 101:8: Ва аммо кимнинг тарозуси енгил келса...
null.verse 101:9: Бас, унинг онаси дўзахдир. (Одатда она доим паноҳ бўлган. Инсон айниқса оғир пайтларда онасига интилгандай, қиёматда ҳам онасини қўмсаганда жаҳаннам уларни она ўрнида кутиб оларкан. Меҳр-муҳаббат, шафқат излаб турганда, кони азобга, қийноққа, даҳшатли оловда ёнишга дуч келиши ниҳоятда катта бахтсизлик.)
null.verse 101:10: У қандоқ нарса эканлигини сенга нима билдирди?
